rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Mocellins|Mocellins]] ([[User talk:Mocellins|talk]]) to last version by Arcadian
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Gghjournal|Gghjournal]] ([[User talk:Gghjournal|talk]]) to last version by Jellytussle
/* Child cancers */ Small discussion on effects of cancer treatment on children later in life
/* Prognosis */ Edited final para of prognosis to remove celebrity examples. See talk.
/* See also */ removed items that are better linked from the text (if at all), moved important lists to top as more useful for readers
/* See also */ alphabetizing list of internal links -- see [[Wikipedia:Guide to layout#See also]]
/* See also */ adding 1 internal link: * [[Bioluminescent activated destruction]] ([[WP:O]])
/* General references */ Add link to Scientific American article
That's trimming too much. I know and use many of those sites, like ASCO, ACS, L&LS, NCI -- why did you delete them? They're not just support and advocacy. Discuss in Talk first.
/* External links */ trimming down considerably - removed all advocacy sites, national bodies, repeating links
/* General references */ moved textbook to gen ref rather than EL
[[Digital object identifier|DOI]] and citation tidying. Problems? [[User_talk:Smith609|Contact]] the bot's [[User:Smith609|operator]].
/* Genetic testing */ added refs to genes
/* Treatment trials */ Here or under CAM?
Repairing [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|links to disambiguation pages]] (and perhaps misc. fixes) using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
Date the maintenance tags or general fixes
/* Childhood cancers */ break out infant cancers
/* External links */ edit asco link descriptions
/* External links */ added asco related links
/* Prognosis */ Updated mention of Tony Snow to reflect his having stepped down

clarify & shortern intro, using the usual terms
reword of lede to rmv. ambiguity as to nature

reintroduce "sometimes" metastatic; not needed for definition of cancer
Fixed the Latin Link, was going to 'crab'
Date the maintenance tags or general fixes
"sometimes metastatic." If it's not metastatic, it's not cancer, is it?
/* Angiogenesis inhibitor */ Explained the problem of multiple angiogenesis factors more clearly. That's the way Judah Folkman explained it.
/* Angiogenesis inhibitor */ Used terminology that non-specialist can understand
/* Angiogenesis inhibitor */ Main article link (consistent with other sections)
/* Angiogenesis inhibitor */ Cited article is only about gene therapy approaches. Need more general citation to support all those claims.
/* Angiogenesis inhibitor */ Angiogenisis inhibitors are in clinical use.
/* Complementary and alternative */ wl, punct, add refs
/* Targeted therapies */ No need for registration mark, unless you're employed by Genentech (R)
rv to last version by JDW
Removed text as holistic approach to cancer has been proven effective
[[WP:WEIGHT]] - is this actually the widely recognised first non-surgical treatment for cancer?
unsure why those need to be mentioned here
